Theorom - 3 :- 

->The maximum number of
 edges in a simple graph
 with n vertices is(n(n-1))/2

Proof :-

-> Let G is a simple Graph
 with n vertices.

-> Since G is a simple Graph
 first vertex can be
 adjacent with maximum
 (n – 1) vertices. So on
 first vertex n – 1 edges
 incident.

-> Now first vertex adjacent
 with second vertex so
 second vertex can be
 adjacent with maximum
 (n – 2) vertices.
 So on second vertex
 maximum (n – 2) new
 edges incident.

=(n-1)+(n-2)+(n-3)+...+1+0

=(n-1)+(n-2)+(n-3)+...+1+n-n

=1+2+3+...+(n-3)+(n-2)
 +(n-1)+n-n

=(n(n+1))/2-n

=(n(n-1))/2
